name: Random Samplers 1 Multiple Choice Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: A Scottish blacksmith named Kirkpatrick MacMillan invented an object in 1839 using, in part, a 'hobby horse', that revolutionized travel for human beings. What was this innovative form of transport?
questions.explanation:
bicycle.

	If only more folks would permit themselves to ride a bicycle...we wouldn't need so many SUVs!

questions.text: During the Ottoman domination of Egypt, by what title was the governor known in the land of the Pharoahs?
In 1895, which actor became the first knighted thespian in Britain?
questions.explanation:
Irving.

	Henry Irving, stage name of John Brodribb, often worked in the Lyceum Theater in London on productions of Shakespeare's plays.

questions.text: What is the Argentine stock exchange called?
questions.explanation:
Merval.

	I imagine that the Merval is in a bit of termoil at the moment thanks to the current financial crisis in Argentina.

questions.text: Name the Irish-born architect who, among other notable works, designed the White House in Washington D. C.
questions.explanation:
Hoban.

	James Hoban also worked on other Washington buildings such as the Capitol. He died in 1831 after a distinguished career.

questions.text: What iconic 19th century American author once wrote under the pseudonym 'Diedrich Knickerbocker'?
questions.explanation:
Washington Irving.

	Irving wrote his 'History of New York' in 1809 under this pseudonym...posing as a Dutchman.

questions.text: Haematite is the most important ore of what metallic element?
questions.explanation:
Iron.

	Haematite has the chemical formula Fe2O3...aka iron oxide. It appears in either the form of 'kidney ore' (so named for its red kidney shape) or 'specular iron ore' which appears as black or gray crystals.

questions.text: Kwashiorkor is a child's disease that results from a deficiency in which required nutrient(s)?
questions.explanation:
proteins.

	Kwashiorkor is a form of malnutrition and results from lack of essential amino acids which are derived from proteins.

questions.text: Which composer is perhaps best known for the 'Saber Dance' in his opera Gayne?
questions.explanation:
Khachaturian.

	Full name: Aram Ilich Khachaturian. It's a very catchy tune...I wish I could hum it for you!

questions.text: What small town in France was the birthplace of Emile Zola, Paul Cezanne and Darius Milhaud?
questions.explanation:
Aix-en-Provence.

	Aix-en-Provence is a lovely town in the south of France near Marseille. Cezanne and Zola were childhood friends!
